item.title: Help plz
item.dc:creator: @Bobbert Bobbert
item.description:
@Bobbert wrote:

[b]This tutorial is by 007 Snoop From Rune-Server.Org I take no credit for this and am no way realted to the creation of this tutorial

Client Editing Tutorial [/b]

[QUOTE=007 Snoop;107821]Hello, In this tutorial you will be instructed on how to edit around a Runescape Client to fit your needs.
This is for new people that do not know how to do this, so please dont flame me saying,"This is for nubs.’’

Ok to begin you need an Open Source Client,
I will add the download link shortly.
Next we need to Identify the important .java files that are used during client editing. *
[LIST]
[]Client.java - The main class of your client.[/LIST][LIST]
[] * Signlink.java - A class in package ‘sign’.
[] * Class30_Sub2_Sub1_sub1.java - .java where the background picture is specified to load from.[/LIST][LIST]
[] * Frame_Sub1 - Creates the swing frame[/LIST]Ok, you want your client fully edited for your server right? So lets begin.
To Change the name of the client go to - Client.java and click Edit > Replace All
Then Input the Client source’s name such as the download is, “Soulscape” and have it changed to your client name here, “Client Name here.”
Once that has been completed go to your Frame_Sub1.java and find where it says, “Soulscape” change that to your client’s name. That will display your clients name at the top left of the application when it is activated.

Now to change the background picture. The should already be a .jpg picture in the clients folder just replace it with another picture that you want as your clients background. [COLOR=Red]WARNING - The picture must be named bg.jpg for it to work!
[/COLOR][COLOR=Red]
[COLOR=Black]Now with that out of the way lets say you want your client to load the cache from a different location than the client folder. Go to the folder named, “sign” and find the signlink.java file and open it. When you have opened the file search for," /cache/" Then replace that with the folder the cache will be loaded from such as, “C:/windows/”
Then right above that you should see, “.file_store_32” change that to the folder that the cache is loaded from such as, “.mpr_file_store_32” that would load it from Moparscape’s downloaded cache.
[COLOR=Red]For all of the above changes to be made, be sure to compile![/COLOR]

That concludes my tutorial, but edits and more things will be added.
Credits are to me for making this.
Comments/posts are appreciated.
Thanks,
007 snoop
[/COLOR][/COLOR][/QUOTE]

Read full topic
